reviewTitle: Great variety and great price for beginners!
reviewDescription: The variety is amazing, and the colors are so vibrant and have a good selection for a beginner or an intermediate looking to get more into the hobby! The beads are very durable on their own, but also after being ironed, they stick together and are tough to break which is perfect for making fun keychains and wall decor! I can definitely recommend this as a fun gift for creative kids and teens and even adults in your life as they're incredibly easy to learn how to use, and all you have to do is have a hand iron to finish them up! Makes a great gift for the holidays, the bead container is durable and can be reused if you buy more beads to replace the used up ones! The kit comes with ample materials to start, and the 4 square bead plates can interlock to form 1 larger square plate for bigger projects!

reviewTitle: Peg boards WILL warp if you're not careful!
reviewDescription: While I do love it, the beads can tend to melt unevenly. Either too quick or too slow to melt. I feel like there's too many shades of blue and not enough of others. I find myself particularly in more need of grays, white and black (Although this came with extra baggies of white and black which I appreciate!) warmer shades, and skin tones. Do NOT use the iron to melt the beads while it's still on the pegboard!! Even with my small crafting iron and short melting time, half of my boards have warped and are unusable.

reviewTitle: Amazing mini beads for making things you can actually USE!
reviewDescription: Awesome MINI version of perler beads! Donâ€™t expect to be able to be able to pick these things up with your fingers- it comes with a tweezers, which youâ€™ll definitely want to use. This kit is not great for little kids. What makes these beads so awesome, is that you can create things you can actually do something with. You can make perler bead designs at a size that are ideal for keychains, jewelry, or patches. And you can make larger designs with amazing detail. The other thing I love is that the designs come out flexible and much less apt to break than perler bead designs. Tips: 1. Make sure youâ€™re not going to get bumped AT ALL while youâ€™re putting your design together. I sat on the couch while making this dragon, and when my dog jumped up with a deafening bark, I pretty much had to start over. 2. Use a med-low iron setting. 3. Be patient after youâ€™re finished ironing. I tried to pull the plastic sheet off before my little bird design had cooled, and some of the melty beads stuck to the sheet. If that happens, itâ€™s fine. Just put the sheet back down and go over it a bit with the iron again. And then wait till it cools. 4. If your design is stuck to the tray when you go to pull it off, use the tweezers to pull up the edges until you have enough up to grab hold. 5. To use a design as a patch to sew onto a bag or something, use a needle to make/enlarge the holes in all the edge beads (after itâ€™s ironed and off the tray). Then use those holes to sew the design onto your bag, etc.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2025

reviewTitle: Super fun, amazing quality, just buy it!
reviewDescription: Love it! Accidentally bought the minis instead of the regular size but that was a blessing in disguise as it had the exact dark green I needed to make my projects! So the variety is awesome. The board warps slightly when ironing but itâ€™s still very usable afterwards. All my projects came out beautifully and they definitely are made to last. I really hope the seller makes it available to purchase one color of beads as Iâ€™m running out of black, white and dark green! Awesome product though, itâ€™s truly helped put my hopes and dreams into reality, donâ€™t think twice and buy it! Not only is it fun to do, but itâ€™s awesome for concentration since the beads are so small and intricate. That said, definitely donâ€™t buy the mini beads for kidsðŸ˜‚ they might eat them.

reviewTitle: Happy accident: Be aware of the size
reviewDescription: I have purchased this multiple times. My kids love them. One note for people new to using these beads: these are smaller than the standard beads. The first time I ordered it, I didnâ€™t know the difference. Upon realizing my mistake, we tried some of the tradition size. It turned out to be a happy mistake because my kids actually prefer these. (Note: my kids are 14, 19, and 21. They do say these are more challenging, so Iâ€™m not sure they would be the best choice for younger crafters. However, the end product is much more detailed with these smaller beads.)
